sorcer.service

Interface Link

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContextLink

    public interface Link
extends java.io.Serializable
    The Link interface allows path values of service contexts to be linked to other service contexts using instances implementing this interface. The interface provides for linking service contexts to persisted subcontexts. Context links are references to an offset (path) in a context, which allows the reuse of other existing service context objects.
    Author:
    Mike Sobolewski

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Context getContext()
      Returns the context associated with this link.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns a name of this link.
      java.lang.String getOffset()
      Returns the path offset into this linked context.
      boolean isFetched()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether the linked context is retrieved from a persistent context storage into this link - true indicating if the linked context is already fetched; false otherwise.
      void isFetched(boolean state)
      Assigns a boolean indicating whether the linked context is retrieved from a persistent context storage into this link.
      boolean isLocal()
      Returns true if the linked context associated with this link is enclosed into the link, otherwise false.
      void setContext(Context ctxt)
      Assigns a link service context associated with this link.
      void setName(java.lang.String name)
      Assign a link name for its linked context.
      void setOffset(java.lang.String offset)
      Sets the offset in this linked context.

      • getOffset

        Returns the path offset into this linked context.
        Returns:
        an offset of this link

      • setOffset

        void setOffset(java.lang.String offset)
        throws ContextException
        Sets the offset in this linked context. If the offset itself is obtained by traversing a link (meaning there is a redundant link), the offset is recalculated and the link object is reset to point to the owning context (removing the redundancy).
        Parameters:
        offset -
        Throws:
        ContextException

      • setContext

      • isLocal

        boolean isLocal()
        Returns true if the linked context associated with this link is enclosed into the link, otherwise false.
        Returns:

      • isFetched

        boolean isFetched()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the linked context is retrieved from a persistent context storage into this link - true indicating if the linked context is already fetched; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the linked context is already fetched
